alert.note: Alert for Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 20 at 11:25PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF PIKE AND NORTHERN SCIOTO COUNTIES THROUGH MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1125 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located 7 miles southwest of Piketon, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Waverly, Piketon, Rosemount, Clarktown, Pike Lake, Lucasville, Beaver, Rarden, Otway, Wakefield, Minford, Givens, Mcdermott, Mount Joy, Bear Creek, Lake White, Lombardsville, Stockdale, Elm Grove and Buchanan. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
